forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
***WHEN*** there will be an official release, ***THEN*** it may be "prime-time". Right now there are bits and pieces, no official pre-compiled binary, lots of ideas, but nothing actually easily testable. I, for one, will wait for it, I am not going to risk the time needed to setup a proper environment to build from source code without knowing if the result will work (and WHY, i.e. because I failed in the compiling). I think we have seen that the fast and good ![:lol:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/laugh.png) past and present development of grub4dos is due to several factors, beside the capabilities and dedication of the developers, that allowed to widen the interested audience: * availability of pre-compiled builds and nightbuilds * dedicated support forum * examples and documentation/guides * attitude of developers to listen to users suggestions
I find the above to have been key factors, that I find completely missing in the grub2 project. See this for an example: [http://www.boot-land...?...c=5275\&st=5](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=5275&st=5 "External link") Has the situation changed lately from your knowledge? :wink: :wink: jaclaz
